template.title: DX issue title
template.description: Detailed description of the DX issue

entries.title: Unclear error messages
entries.description: Error messages dont indicate which stage failed
entries.impact: Debugging takes longer than necessary

entries.title: Unclear error messages
entries.description: Error messages dont indicate which stage failed
entries.context: When debugging pipeline failures
entries.impact: Debugging takes longer than necessary
entries.recommendation: Include stage name and ID in all error messages

entries.title: OutputBag thread-safety documentation incomplete
entries.description: The documentation states that write() is thread-safe due to asyncio.Lock(), but does not clearly document which read operations are safe and which are not. This ambiguity could lead developers to incorrectly assume all operations are protected.
entries.impact: Developers may write code that reads from OutputBag during concurrent writes, potentially encountering inconsistent state.
entries.recommendation: Add a section to the OutputBag documentation explicitly stating which methods are thread-safe and which require external synchronization.

entries.title: Confusing API for creating test StageContexts
entries.description: Creating a StageContext for testing requires deep knowledge of internal types like RunIdentity, PipelineTimer, and proper ContextSnapshot construction. The create_test_stage_context helper exists but its parameters are not well documented.
entries.context: While writing recovery tests, had to check signatures of ContextSnapshot, RunIdentity, StageContext, and PipelineTimer to construct a valid test context.
entries.impact: Increases testing friction and onboarding time
entries.recommendation: Add comprehensive examples in documentation showing how to create test contexts, or provide a simpler helper that accepts basic parameters.

entries.title: Module import complexity in test environment
entries.description: Setting up test imports required complex sys.path manipulation. The mocks and pipelines modules were not discoverable without explicit path additions.
entries.context: Running pytest tests in the run directory required manual sys.path manipulation
entries.impact: Minor friction in test setup, not blocking but adds boilerplate
entries.recommendation: Consider adding a pytest plugin or conftest.py that automatically configures the path for run directories

entries.title: Pipeline API discoverability
entries.description: The Pipeline class uses with_stage() method but documentation and examples show both Pipeline() and PipelineBuilder(). New users may not know which to use or that Pipeline is immutable (returns new instance on each with_stage() call).
entries.context: Initial test development required reading API docs to understand Pipeline vs PipelineBuilder
entries.impact: Slower onboarding for new users
entries.recommendation: Add deprecation warning or unify the API, provide clearer examples

entries.title: Limited observability of context propagation
entries.description: No built-in way to trace how context flows through nested pipelines. Debugging context issues requires manual instrumentation.
entries.impact: Debugging context propagation issues takes longer than necessary
entries.recommendation: Add built-in context propagation events that log context changes at fork points

entries.title: Complex setup for memory tracking
entries.description: Setting up memory tracking in custom stages requires significant boilerplate code including tracemalloc initialization, snapshot management, and stats comparison.
entries.context: Building test pipelines for memory growth bounds
entries.impact: Increased development time and complexity for memory testing
entries.recommendation: Provide built-in memory tracking utilities in Stageflow core or as a helper module

entries.title: Pipeline API requires studying examples to understand correct usage
entries.description: The Pipeline constructor and with_stage() method signatures are not intuitive - Pipeline() does not accept name parameter, and stages dict requires UnifiedStageSpec wrapping
entries.impact: Time to first pipeline increased due to API confusion
entries.recommendation: Consider adding Pipeline(name=...) constructor or clearer error messages

entries.title: API documentation mismatch for context classes
entries.description: MemoryEnrichment, Conversation, and DocumentEnrichment have different parameter names than documented. MemoryEnrichment expects recent_topics/key_facts not memories/short_term. Conversation doesn't accept input_text parameter. DocumentEnrichment expects document_id/blocks not doc_id/title/content.
entries.context: While implementing delta compression test pipelines, discovered that documented API signatures don't match actual implementation
entries.impact: Developers following documentation will encounter TypeErrors when creating context snapshots
entries.recommendation: Update documentation to match actual API or add validation that provides helpful error messages

entries.title: Pipeline.with_stage() lacks config parameter support
entries.description: The documented Pipeline.with_stage() method doesn't accept a config parameter, unlike the add_stage() method pattern used in examples. This makes it difficult to configure stages with different behaviors in the same pipeline.
entries.context: When creating test pipelines with configurable stages, discovered that with_stage() doesn't support config keyword argument
entries.impact: Must create separate stage instances for each configuration instead of reusing stage classes
entries.recommendation: Add config parameter to with_stage() or document the alternative pattern for configurable stages

entries.title: PipelineContext.fork() parameter naming inconsistency
entries.description: PipelineContext.fork() uses child_run_id as first positional parameter but documentation suggests parent_run_id naming convention
entries.context: Testing fork() method required trial and error to discover correct parameter names
entries.impact: Minor friction when testing subpipeline functionality
entries.recommendation: Update documentation to clearly list parameter names or accept both naming conventions

entries.title: Context setup complexity
entries.description: Setting up pipeline execution context requires understanding multiple components (PipelineContext, StageContext, timers)
entries.context: When building test pipelines, proper context setup for execution requires careful attention to API requirements
entries.impact: Increases learning curve for new developers
entries.recommendation: Provide more examples of complete pipeline execution setup

entries.title: Unclear API for accessing pipeline context from stages
entries.description: The documentation and API do not clearly indicate how stages should access shared pipeline state. The StageContext lacks pipeline_ctx, and ctx.data is not accessible.
entries.context: When trying to test shared resource contention, needed to access ctx.pipeline_ctx.data
entries.impact: Developers cannot easily implement stages that share mutable state
entries.recommendation: Document the correct pattern for state sharing or add pipeline_ctx property

entries.title: Unclear how to implement retry after GUARD failure
entries.description: The documentation shows how GUARD stages work but does not explain how to implement retry logic or autocorrection loops when a guard rejects output.
entries.context: Building autocorrection test pipelines
entries.impact: Developers must experiment to understand retry patterns
entries.recommendation: Add examples showing ROUTE-based retry and interceptor-based retry patterns

entries.title: StageOutput.error() API is not callable
entries.description: The StageOutput class has an `error` property that is not callable, but the intuitive API suggests using StageOutput.error() to create error outputs. The correct method is StageOutput.fail(), which is not immediately obvious from the API surface.
entries.context: While building test pipelines for DAG-004, I attempted to use StageOutput.error() following the pattern of StageOutput.ok(). This caused a TypeError at runtime.
entries.impact: Developers must consult documentation or error messages to discover the correct fail() method, slowing down development.
entries.recommendation: Either add StageOutput.error() as an alias for StageOutput.fail(), or clearly document the fail() method in the StageOutput class docstring.

entries.title: Verbose pipeline construction for large DAGs
entries.description: Building pipelines with 1000+ stages requires a loop with dynamic stage class creation, which is verbose and error-prone
entries.context: Creating a linear pipeline with 1000 stages required 50+ lines of boilerplate code
entries.impact: Developer experience friction when building large pipelines
entries.recommendation: Consider adding a helper method like Pipeline.with_linear_stages(count, stage_class)

entries.title: No built-in progress tracking for long pipelines
entries.description: Long-running pipelines have no built-in progress reporting or logging
entries.context: Running 2000-stage pipeline provides no feedback until completion
entries.impact: Difficulty debugging and monitoring deep pipelines
entries.recommendation: Add optional progress callbacks or logging intervals

entries.title: Pipeline immutability not documented
entries.description: The fact that pipelines are immutable after build() is not clearly documented, leading to confusion about dynamic modification capabilities
entries.impact: Developers may attempt to modify pipelines at runtime expecting it to work
entries.recommendation: Add clear documentation about pipeline immutability and alternative patterns for dynamic behavior

entries.title: StageOutput.cancel() cancels entire pipeline
entries.description: When a stage returns StageOutput.cancel(reason=...), the entire pipeline is cancelled and no further stages execute. This may be unexpected behavior for users who want to cancel just one branch while allowing other branches to continue.
entries.context: When a router stage returns cancel(), all downstream stages are skipped even if they do not depend on the router output
entries.impact: Cannot implement conditional cancellation of individual branches
entries.recommendation: Document this behavior clearly or provide a way to cancel just one branch

entries.title: Context creation requires multiple parameters
entries.description: Creating a StageContext requires providing inputs, stage_name, and timer even for simple test scenarios. The create_stage_context helper does not reduce this complexity.
entries.context: Quick tests or examples require boilerplate to create proper context objects
entries.impact: Increased friction for new users trying the framework
entries.recommendation: Consider providing a simpler context factory for testing or documentation with clear examples

entries.title: Confusing PipelineContext vs StageContext API
entries.description: Stageflow uses two different context types: PipelineContext for graph.run() and StageContext for stage.execute(). They have different attributes (PipelineContext has data but no timer, StageContext has timer but no data). This creates confusion and compatibility issues.
entries.impact: Developers struggle to understand which context to use and when
entries.recommendation: Add a unified context interface or clear documentation on when to use each

entries.title: Complex StageContext initialization
entries.description: StageContext requires multiple positional arguments making basic usage non-intuitive
entries.context: Initial testing required reading examples to understand proper ContextSnapshot and StageContext usage
entries.impact: Steeper learning curve for new users
entries.recommendation: Add convenience constructors or factory methods

entries.title: No schema documentation standard for stages
entries.description: There is no standard way to document expected StageOutput schemas for stages. Each stage defines its output structure independently without a common format for schema documentation, making it difficult for downstream consumers to understand contract requirements.
entries.context: When building test pipelines, had to manually discover what fields each stage produces. No central registry or documentation format exists.
entries.impact: Developers must inspect stage code to understand output contracts, increasing integration time and risk of misunderstanding.
entries.recommendation: Create a standard schema documentation format (e.g., JSON Schema) for StageOutput and provide tooling to generate documentation automatically.

entries.title: Inconsistent partial result handling between fail and cancel
entries.description: StageOutput.cancel() provides partial results via UnifiedPipelineCancelled.results, but StageOutput.fail() via StageExecutionError does not. This inconsistency creates confusion about when partial results are available.
entries.context: Developers expect consistent behavior between failure modes
entries.impact: Developers must handle two different exception patterns with different data availability
entries.recommendation: Document the behavior difference clearly or unify the exception interfaces

entries.title: Missing documentation on partial output handling
entries.description: The error handling guide does not document what happens to stage outputs when a pipeline fails. Specifically, it does not explain the difference between UnifiedPipelineCancelled.results and StageExecutionError lacking results.
entries.context: Users need to understand partial result availability after failures
entries.recommendation: Add section documenting partial output handling for each exception type

entries.title: Missing actionable guidance in contract violation errors
entries.description: Error messages for contract violations (cycles, dependencies, validation) lack actionable guidance. Only 4.8% of error messages scored on this criterion. Errors tell users what went wrong but not how to fix it.
entries.context: Testing CONTRACT-004 error message quality
entries.impact: Developers must consult documentation or source code to resolve common issues
entries.recommendation: Add fix suggestions to all contract violation errors (e.g., cycle errors should suggest which stages to remove or rewire)

entries.title: No documentation links in error messages
entries.description: Error messages contain zero documentation references (0% score). Industry best practices recommend including links to relevant documentation sections. This forces developers to search for solutions.
entries.context: Error message quality analysis for CONTRACT-004
entries.impact: Developers waste time finding relevant documentation
entries.recommendation: Add doc links to error messages (e.g., "See https://docs.stageflow.io/contract-validation for guidance")

entries.title: No explicit way to declare required stage outputs
entries.description: Stages have no mechanism to declare which output fields they require from upstream stages. This makes it difficult to understand stage contracts and leads to silent failures when required data is missing.
entries.impact: Developers must manually check for None values in every stage, increasing boilerplate and risk of missed validation.

entries.title: No documentation on nested object validation patterns
entries.description: Stageflow documentation does not explain how to validate nested objects in StageOutput or ContextSnapshot. Users must discover through trial and error that no automatic validation exists.
entries.context: Attempting to understand how Stageflow validates nested structures in StageOutput.data
entries.impact: Users may incorrectly assume nested data is validated when it is not
entries.recommendation: Add documentation section explaining that StageOutput.data is unvalidated dict[str, Any] and provide examples of how to implement Pydantic-based validation

entries.title: Missing validation patterns documentation
entries.description: No examples or guides for implementing validation patterns in Stageflow. Developers must infer patterns from interceptor and GUARD stage documentation.
entries.context: Researching validation patterns required reading interceptor docs and inferring how validators might integrate.
entries.impact: Longer onboarding time, inconsistent implementations across teams, missed best practices.
entries.recommendation: Add a dedicated validation guide with patterns for: input validation, output validation, cross-field validation, async validation, and validator composition.

entries.title: Unclear error messages for modality failures
entries.description: When a stage fails due to modality-specific issue (corrupted audio, invalid image), error message does not indicate which modality failed.
entries.impact: Debugging multimodal pipelines takes longer than necessary
entries.recommendation: Enhance error messages to include modality context and suggest remediation steps

entries.title: ContextSnapshot metadata usage is unclear
entries.description: The documentation does not clearly explain how to pass arbitrary data to stages. ContextSnapshot uses input_text for text and metadata for additional data, but this is not well documented.
entries.impact: Developers must read source code to understand data passing patterns

entries.title: Ambiguous date formats silently default to US interpretation
entries.description: When parsing dates like 01/02/2023, the dateutil library defaults to US interpretation (MM/DD/YYYY). This is a silent behavior that could lead to data corruption without any warning.
entries.context: Testing TRANSFORM-003 format-induced misinterpretation
entries.impact: International users may get incorrect date interpretations without any warning
entries.recommendation: Add warning logs or validation for ambiguous dates, or require explicit date format specification

entries.title: Missing timestamp handling documentation
entries.description: Stageflow documentation lacks guidance on timestamp extraction and normalization patterns. Developers implementing timestamp processing must rely on external Python libraries without framework-specific best practices.
entries.context: Implementing TRANSFORM-004 timestamp extraction stages required researching dateutil.parser and timestamp formats independently.
entries.impact: Developers spend extra time researching timestamp handling patterns instead of focusing on business logic.
entries.recommendation: Add a dedicated guide for timestamp handling covering common formats, timezone best practices, and example stages.

entries.title: StageContext.emit_event method does not exist
entries.description: The Stageflow documentation at stageflow-docs/guides/stages.md and stageflow-docs/api/core.md shows ctx.emit_event() as the method to emit events, but the actual API only has ctx.try_emit_event(). This causes AttributeError when following documentation.
entries.context: Following the Observability guide in stageflow-docs/guides/observability.md which shows emit_event usage
entries.impact: Blocks developers from implementing observability in custom stages
entries.recommendation: Either add emit_event as an alias or update documentation to use try_emit_event

entries.title: StageContext timer parameter is required but unclear
entries.description: Creating a StageContext requires a PipelineTimer argument, but the documentation does not emphasize this requirement. The API signature shows timer as required, causing TypeError when omitted.
entries.context: Creating StageContext for pipeline testing following examples in stageflow-docs/examples/
entries.impact: Developer friction when creating test contexts or manual pipeline execution
entries.recommendation: Add factory function like create_stage_context() that provides default timer, or make timer optional with default

entries.title: ChunkQueue documentation unclear about blocking behavior
entries.description: The ChunkQueue documentation does not clearly explain that put() blocks indefinitely when the queue is full and drop_on_overflow=False. This caused confusion during testing.
entries.context: When building streaming test pipelines, expected put() to return False when full, but it blocked instead
entries.impact: Developers may unintentionally create blocking pipelines
entries.recommendation: Add clear documentation about blocking vs dropping behavior, with examples of both modes

entries.title: Error messages lack actionable recovery guidance
entries.description: When a stage fails with StageOutput.fail(), the error message provides context but lacks guidance on how to recover or retry. For example, the message `Simulated failure after 5 items` does not indicate whether retry is appropriate or how to access partial results.
entries.context: When testing partial failure scenarios, error messages did not indicate if retry was possible or how to recover partial results
entries.impact: Debugging recovery scenarios takes longer than necessary
entries.recommendation: Add recovery_hint field to StageOutput.fail() that indicates whether retry is recommended and provides guidance

entries.title: Verbose failure mode configuration in chaos testing
entries.description: Configuring failure injection for chaos testing requires verbose code with manual mode setting and probability configuration.
entries.context: When setting up chaos tests, configuring failure modes requires multiple method calls.
entries.impact: Slows down chaos testing setup and makes test code harder to read.
entries.recommendation: Add factory methods for common failure scenarios like create_empty_retrieval_mock(), create_distractor_only_mock().

entries.title: Pipeline immutability not clearly documented
entries.description: Pipeline.with_stage() returns a new Pipeline instance, but the immutable nature is not clearly documented. Developers must reassign the pipeline variable (pipeline = pipeline.with_stage(...)), which is easy to miss.
entries.context: During implementation of enrich002_pipelines.py, stages were not being added to the pipeline because the return value was not being reassigned
entries.impact: Silent failures where pipeline stages are not executed
entries.recommendation: Add prominent documentation about pipeline immutability and consider adding a warning or deprecation for in-place modifications

entries.title: StageInputs.get_from() lacks default parameter
entries.description: StageInputs.get_from(stage_name, key) does not accept a default value like dict.get(). This forces developers to use verbose patterns like: val = ctx.inputs.get_from("stage", "key"); if val is None: val = default
entries.context: In MetricsCollectionStage.execute(), needed to safely get values with defaults but get_from() does not support default values
entries.impact: More verbose code and potential None handling issues
entries.recommendation: Add optional default parameter to get_from() method

entries.title: Missing documentation for citation verification patterns
entries.description: Documentation lacks clear guidance on implementing citation verification in ENRICH stages. No examples show how to verify citations against retrieved sources or detect hallucinated citations.
entries.impact: Developers must implement citation verification from scratch without guidance, leading to inconsistent implementations and potential security gaps.
entries.recommendation: Add comprehensive documentation section covering: citation verification patterns, integration with GUARD stages, adversarial input handling, and best practices for legal/medical/financial use cases.

entries.title: No guidance on document versioning patterns in ENRICH documentation
entries.description: The ENRICH stage documentation does not mention document versioning, version resolution strategies, or temporal validation. Builders must discover these patterns through experimentation.
entries.impact: Builders implementing RAG pipelines with versioned documents are likely to encounter version conflicts without knowing best practices.
entries.recommendation: Add a section on document versioning to the ENRICH stage documentation covering: version metadata patterns, temporal validation, conflict resolution strategies, and citation tracking.

entries.title: No context utilization visibility in StageContext
entries.description: When building RAG pipelines, there is no way to track cumulative context utilization from within stages. This makes it difficult to implement context-aware behavior.
entries.context: To implement context boundary-aware retrieval, I needed to build custom tracking infrastructure rather than using framework-provided utilities.
entries.impact: Builders must implement their own context tracking, leading to inconsistent approaches across pipelines.
entries.recommendation: Add context_utilization property to StageContext that tracks cumulative token usage and remaining capacity.

entries.title: Stage dependencies validation is strict but helpful
entries.description: The StageInputs validation that requires explicit declaration of dependencies when using get_from() prevents silent failures. When I tried to access output from kg_query_parser without declaring it as a dependency, the framework raised UndeclaredDependencyError immediately.
entries.context: Building GraphRAG pipelines with multiple stages
entries.impact: Catches configuration errors early at build time rather than at runtime
entries.recommendation: Document this pattern clearly so developers understand they must declare all stage dependencies

entries.title: StageOutput API documentation unclear about kwargs support
entries.description: The Stageflow documentation at stageflow-docs/api/core.md does not clearly specify which StageOutput methods accept additional keyword arguments. The StageOutput.fail() signature only shows error and data parameters, leading developers to assume they can extend it like ok(). This causes TypeErrors at runtime.
entries.context: Attempted to pass test_name to StageOutput.fail() for debugging, which failed at runtime
entries.impact: Developers waste time debugging TypeErrors when trying to extend StageOutput
entries.recommendation: Document which methods accept **kwargs and provide examples of extensibility patterns

entries.title: emit_event method not available on StageContext
entries.description: StageContext only provides try_emit_event(), not emit_event(). The documentation shows emit_event() but it does not exist on the actual API.
entries.context: When implementing enrichment stages, tried to use ctx.emit_event() for telemetry but it raised AttributeError
entries.impact: Developers following documentation will encounter runtime errors and need to find the workaround through trial and error
entries.recommendation: Add emit_event() as an alias for try_emit_event() or update documentation to show the correct method name

entries.title: ContextSnapshot signature does not match documentation
entries.description: ContextSnapshot does not accept user_id, session_id as direct parameters. The actual parameters are run_id (with RunIdentity), metadata, enrichments, etc.
entries.context: Following the guides to create a context for pipeline execution, had to use RunIdentity nested in run_id instead of direct user_id/session_id parameters
entries.impact: Code examples in documentation do not work out of the box, causing confusion for new developers
entries.recommendation: Update documentation examples to show the correct ContextSnapshot construction pattern with RunIdentity

entries.title: Pipeline.with_stage() returns new instance instead of modifying
entries.description: Pipeline.with_stage() does not modify the pipeline in place but returns a new Pipeline instance. This is unexpected and requires assigning the result back to the variable.
entries.context: When building pipelines, pipeline.with_stage(...) without assignment did not add the stage to the pipeline
entries.impact: Developers must write pipeline = pipeline.with_stage(...) instead of the more intuitive pipeline.with_stage(...) pattern
entries.recommendation: Consider making with_stage() modify the instance in place, or add a clear docstring warning about the return value pattern

entries.title: Silent failure detection requires manual implementation
entries.description: The framework does not provide built-in silent failure detection for ENRICH stages. Developers must manually implement checks for empty result sets in their validation stages.
entries.context: Implementing validation for metadata filtering pipeline
entries.impact: Developers may miss silent failures in production if they forget to implement empty-result checks
entries.recommendation: Add a built-in silent_failure flag or check that can be enabled on ENRICH stages

entries.title: API discoverability issues for Pipeline execution
entries.description: Pipeline object does not have a run() method, requires build() first to get StageGraph. Documentation shows examples with graph.run() but API is not obvious from Pipeline class
entries.context: While implementing baseline pipeline, attempted Pipeline.run() which doesn't exist. Had to read pipeline.md to understand need for build() first
entries.impact: Increased learning curve for new developers
entries.recommendation: Add Pipeline.run() convenience method or improve error message to suggest using build()

entries.title: ContextSnapshot priority field documentation gap
entries.description: Priority must be stored in metadata dict, not as a direct field. This is not clearly documented and required investigation to discover.
entries.context: When trying to pass priority to a ROUTE stage, attempted ctx.snapshot.priority which does not exist.
entries.impact: Time spent investigating how to pass priority to routing stages

entries.title: No Built-in Fallback Chain Management
entries.description: Stageflow lacks a built-in mechanism for managing multi-tier fallback chains. Developers must implement their own fallback logic with route tracking
entries.context: Implementing fallback path correctness testing required custom FallbackRouter implementation
entries.impact: Increased development time for complex routing scenarios requiring multi-tier fallback
entries.recommendation: Add a FallbackChainStage or utility class for managing fallback chains with built-in route history tracking

entries.title: Circuit Breaker Not Integrated with ROUTE Stages
entries.description: Circuit breaker functionality is not integrated with ROUTE stages. Developers must implement circuit breaker logic separately and integrate it manually with routing stages
entries.context: Testing fallback path correctness required separate circuit breaker mock implementation
entries.impact: More boilerplate code, risk of integration errors when combining circuit breakers with routing
entries.recommendation: Add optional circuit breaker parameter to ROUTE stage or create a CircuitBreakerMixin for easy integration

entries.title: create_pipeline_context function does not exist
entries.description: Documentation and code examples suggest using create_pipeline_context but the actual function is create_test_stage_context with different semantics
entries.context: When building test pipelines, attempted to use create_pipeline_context as shown in examples but received ImportError
entries.impact: Time wasted debugging import issues during test pipeline development
entries.recommendation: Update documentation to use correct function name or add alias for backward compatibility

entries.title: Research section needs better examples
entries.description: The research summary in the prompt mentions specific docs but the actual documentation is sparse. More concrete examples would help.
entries.context: When researching multi-criteria routing patterns, documentation examples were limited
entries.impact: Minor friction during research phase
entries.recommendation: Add more code examples to research summaries

entries.title: StageInputs user_id Access Pattern Unclear
entries.description: The pattern for accessing user_id in stages is not well documented. Stages must read from ctx.snapshot.run_id.user_id rather than ctx.inputs.get("user_id")
entries.context: A/B testing stages need to identify users for consistent bucketing
entries.impact: Increased development time to discover correct access pattern
entries.recommendation: Document the recommended pattern for user identification in stages, or provide a helper method on StageContext

entries.title: ContextSnapshot API complexity for newcomers
entries.description: The ContextSnapshot constructor uses RunIdentity bundles instead of flat fields, which is unintuitive. Documentation examples show older flat field pattern.
entries.context: When creating test contexts for pipeline testing
entries.impact: Increased learning curve for new developers
entries.recommendation: Add helper functions for common context creation patterns

entries.title: No built-in prompt injection testing utilities
entries.description: Stageflow does not provide built-in utilities for testing prompt injection resistance. Developers must build their own test harnesses and injection datasets.
entries.context: Building GUARD-001 test pipelines required creating custom mock LLM, test data generators, and attack vectors from scratch
entries.impact: Increases development time for security testing and may lead to incomplete test coverage
entries.recommendation: Add built-in injection detection utilities, test data generators, and attack vectors to the framework

entries.title: StageContext import location unclear
entries.description: StageContext should be imported from stageflow but docs suggest stageflow.stages.context
entries.context: When building GUARD-004 test pipelines, attempted import from stageflow.stages.context which does not exist
entries.impact: Developer time wasted debugging import errors
entries.recommendation: Update docs to show correct import: from stageflow import StageContext

entries.title: Rate limit headers not standardized
entries.description: Rate limit response data format varies between different implementations
entries.impact: Debugging and monitoring requires custom code to parse rate limit responses
entries.recommendation: Standardize rate limit response format across all limiter types

entries.title: Content moderation API discoverability is poor
entries.description: The available content moderation helpers are not clearly documented. The InjectionDetector is referenced in documentation but not available in the helpers module.
entries.context: While reading stageflow-docs/api/helpers.md, found references to InjectionDetector but import failed at runtime.
entries.impact: Developers waste time trying to import non-existent components.
entries.recommendation: Update documentation to match actual exports, or add the missing components.

entries.title: UnifiedStageGraph.run() argument naming is inconsistent
entries.description: StageGraph.run() takes ctx parameter but documentation and examples sometimes refer to it as context. The PipelineContext vs StageContext distinction is also not clearly explained.
entries.context: Building test pipelines for adversarial input fuzzing
entries.impact: Minor confusion during implementation
entries.recommendation: Standardize parameter naming and add clarification in documentation about when to use PipelineContext vs StageContext

entries.title: No Built-in Guard Performance Monitoring
entries.description: The Stage framework does not provide built-in performance monitoring for guard stages. Developers must manually instrument guard latency tracking.
entries.context: Building performance test pipelines for GUARD-008 required custom latency tracking in each guard stage.
entries.impact: Difficulty in identifying performance bottlenecks in production guard stages.
entries.recommendation: Add optional performance metrics to GuardStage base class (guard_latency_ms, cache_hit_rate, etc.).

entries.title: Missing documentation for cross-lingual content filtering patterns
entries.description: The governance guide covers basic guardrails but lacks guidance on multi-language content filtering patterns, including how to handle low-resource languages, code-mixing, and translate-classify pipelines.
entries.context: Building multi-language content filtering pipelines required research into translate-classify patterns and manual implementation of language detection, filtering, and translation stages
entries.impact: Developers must piece together information from multiple sources and implement common patterns from scratch

entries.title: ContextSnapshot vs PipelineContext documentation unclear
entries.description: Documentation does not clearly explain when to use ContextSnapshot vs PipelineContext. The ContextSnapshot API reference shows it has convenience properties like pipeline_run_id, user_id, session_id, but these cannot be set directly in the constructor - they must be set via RunIdentity. This creates confusion for developers trying to create test contexts.
entries.context: Creating test ContextSnapshot instances for pipeline testing
entries.impact: Developers spend extra time figuring out correct ContextSnapshot construction
entries.recommendation: Add examples showing ContextSnapshot creation for testing, clearly show RunIdentity usage

entries.title: Tool registry API documentation gaps
entries.description: The ToolRegistry and ToolExecutor APIs have changed but documentation has not been updated. register_tool is now register, and StageGraph requires StageSpec objects
entries.impact: Developers following the documentation will encounter errors when trying to register tools or create stage graphs

entries.title: No guidance on idempotency implementation for WORK stages
entries.description: Stageflow documentation lacks guidance on implementing idempotency in WORK stages. Developers must discover best practices through trial and error or external research.
entries.context: Building idempotent WORK stages requires understanding complex distributed systems patterns.
entries.impact: Developers may implement incorrect idempotency, leading to production bugs. Learning curve is steeper than necessary.
entries.recommendation: Add comprehensive documentation on idempotency patterns including: idempotency key design, parameter validation, caching strategies, concurrency handling.

entries.title: Missing Saga Pattern Documentation
entries.description: Stageflow documentation lacks guidance on implementing Saga pattern for multi-step operations with compensation
entries.impact: Developers must figure out Saga implementation patterns independently
entries.recommendation: Add a guide on Saga pattern implementation with WORK stages including compensation patterns

entries.title: Missing Retry Documentation in Stageflow Docs
entries.description: The Stageflow documentation does not include comprehensive guidance on implementing retry logic with exponential backoff. The interceptors guide shows how to create custom interceptors but does not demonstrate retry patterns.
entries.context: While building test pipelines for WORK-005, had to search for retry patterns in external resources and previous test implementations.
entries.impact: Developers implementing retry logic must either discover patterns through code or external resources, leading to inconsistent implementations.
entries.recommendation: Add comprehensive retry documentation covering: 1) RetryInterceptor implementation examples, 2) Backoff strategy selection guide, 3) Jitter configuration best practices, 4) StageOutput.retry() integration patterns

entries.title: Error Classification API Discoverability
entries.description: The error classification heuristics are distributed across multiple stage implementations rather than being centralized in a reusable classifier component.
entries.context: When building error classification test pipelines, we had to implement our own ErrorClassifyingStage with classification heuristics that should be provided by the framework.
entries.impact: Developers must implement error classification logic repeatedly across different stages, leading to inconsistent handling patterns.
entries.recommendation: Provide a built-in ErrorClassifier utility that can be reused across stages, with extensible provider-specific knowledge base.

entries.title: PipelineContext API requires many parameters
entries.description: Creating a PipelineContext requires 6+ parameters including pipeline_run_id, request_id, session_id, user_id, org_id, and interaction_id. This makes testing cumbersome.
entries.context: When building test pipelines, had to manually create UUIDs for all required fields. Missing any resulted in TypeError.
entries.impact: Increased boilerplate code for testing, steeper learning curve for new developers
entries.recommendation: Consider providing a create_test_pipeline_context() factory function or make some fields optional with defaults.

entries.title: No Discoverable Output Validation Mechanism
entries.description: The documentation and API do not provide any mechanism for validating tool outputs. Developers expecting output validation will not find any guidance or built-in functionality.
entries.context: Attempted to validate tool outputs using industry-standard patterns but found no support in Stageflow.
entries.impact: Developers may assume output validation exists and build unreliable pipelines
entries.recommendation: Add documentation about output validation gaps and provide workarounds or patterns for manual validation

entries.title: Checkpoint/restore patterns not documented
entries.description: Documentation lacks examples of checkpoint capture and state restoration patterns
entries.context: Had to derive checkpoint pattern from ContextSnapshot.to_dict/from_dict API
entries.impact: Increased development time for implementing rollback testing
entries.recommendation: Add dedicated section on state management with checkpoint/restore examples
